title: How to Lose Weight the Healthy Way

steps.title: Talk to your doctor about weight loss.
steps.content: Talk to your doctor about weight loss. Be sure you need to lose weight, and that this is the best time for you to proceed with weight loss. If you are pregnant or have a medical condition, your body may need added calories to maintain your health, so this is not the time to start losing weight. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you have medical conditions such as hypertension, diabetes, or cardiovascular problems, talk to your doctor before starting a diet and exercise plan. [2] X Expert Source Pouya Shafipour, MD, MS Board Certified Family Medicine Specialist Expert Interview. 8 May 2020. Many factors, including age, current weight, and overall physical health, should be discussed with your doctor in order to safely start a diet and exercise plan. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Set reasonable and realistic goals.
steps.content: Set reasonable and realistic goals. Weight loss of 0.5 to 2 pounds per week is a healthy approach. Allow yourself the time you need to reach your weight loss goal, planning on a loss of up to 2 lbs. each week. [4] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source While it may be tempting to pursue fad diets with promises of fast weight loss, a slow and steady approach is the healthiest way to lose weight. [5] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source It also provides ample time for your skin to adjust and helps you lose the weight without developing loose skin . While fad diets may help you drop weight quickly, they are not sustainable long term and once you stop the fad diet, you often gain back the weight plus more.

steps.title: Incorporate your daily calorie target in your plan.
steps.content: Incorporate your daily calorie target in your plan. Weight loss happens when you burn more calories than you consume. Your doctor can help determine the number of calories to consume each day specific to your body, age, sex, and lifestyle.

steps.title: Do the math.
steps.content: Do the math. One pound is equal to about 3,500 calories. In order to lose 1 to 2 pounds each week, your daily calorie consumption needs to decrease by about 500 to 1000 calories, or your activity level needs to increase to burn more calories. [6] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source As an example, a moderately active 35-year-old female needs to consume about 2000 calories per day to maintain her current weight. A target goal of 1400 to 1600 calories per day will create a situation of weight loss for this person. Daily calorie goals factor in age, sex, and level of physical activity. Some medical conditions can be a factor that may also need to be considered.

steps.title: Download a food logging app onto your computer or phone and log everything you eat.
steps.content: Download a food logging app onto your computer or phone and log everything you eat. This way you know your calories every day.

steps.title: Avoid setting your daily calorie goal too low.
steps.content: Avoid setting your daily calorie goal too low. This can actually prevent you from losing weight. When you skip meals or consume too few calories, your body starts to store calories as fat instead of burning them.

steps.title: Come up with a plan that fits your own likes and dislikes.
steps.content: Come up with a plan that fits your own likes and dislikes. Many healthy weight loss plans already exist and can be tweaked to suit your own preferences and needs. Whether you tweak a formal diet plan or come up with your own, be sure it is suited to you and is a plan you can live with for a long time, not just for a few months. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For a successful healthy lifestyle change, it is important that your new plan fit into your life without too much difficulty. Adjusting how you eat and exercise is one thing, completely changing to foods you don't normally eat and exercises you don't enjoy will most likely not be successful long term. [8] X Expert Source Pouya Shafipour, MD, MS Board Certified Family Medicine Specialist Expert Interview. 8 May 2020.

steps.title: Consider your past experience with weight loss plans.
steps.content: Consider your past experience with weight loss plans. As you develop your plan, incorporate what worked, and leave out what did not work. [9] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Build in some flexibility.
steps.content: Build in some flexibility. Add your own personal preferences, and include flexibility in both your food and physical activity choices. Plus, consider your preference to diet all alone or if you prefer support from a friend or group. [10] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Create a plan that fits your budget.
steps.content: Create a plan that fits your budget. Some diet programs involve added costs. The added expense may be from a gym membership, joining a specific group, purchasing specific food items like supplements or meals, or attending regular appointments or group meetings. [11] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Increase your physical activity and make this a part of your plan.
steps.content: Increase your physical activity and make this a part of your plan. Consider expanding on activities you already enjoy, like walking, Zumba dancing, biking, or yoga. Establish a physical activity routine that you can live with, for the long run. An exercise routine that includes aerobic activity and muscle development is ideal, but just increasing your level of activity is a great place to start. [12] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Set your activity goal.
steps.content: Set your activity goal. Work towards 150 minutes or more per week of moderate physical activity, or 75 minutes of more vigorous aerobic activity or exercise, spread evenly throughout the week. [13] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Recognize the difference between physical activity and exercise.
steps.content: Recognize the difference between physical activity and exercise. Physical activity includes the things you already do every day, such as walking, housework, yard work, and running around in the yard with the kids, grandkids, or the family pet. Exercise involves structured, scheduled, and repetitive forms of activity that you do regularly. [14] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source However, seeking to add additional physical activity (taking the stairs rather than the elevator, walking rather than driving, etc.) can be a great way to reach your goals.

steps.title: Calculate your current and target BMI.
steps.content: Calculate your current and target BMI. Your doctor can tell you what your body mass index, or BMI is. A healthy BMI range is between 18.5 and 25. [15] X Research source [16] X Research source The formula to calculate BMI is a little confusing, but if you want to calculate your BMI, then follow these steps. Your BMI is your weight in kilograms (not pounds) divided by your height (in meters) squared. [17] X Research source Here is an example. For someone that is 5 feet 6 inches tall and weighs 165 pounds, the formula reveals the BMI to be 27.3. [18] X Research source Convert the pounds into kilograms. Do this by multiplying the weight in pounds by 0.45. So 165 x 0.45 = 74.25. Next, convert the height to meters. 5 feet 6 inches is 66 inches. Multiply the 66 by 0.025 to get 1.65 meters. Then square that number by multiplying it against itself, so 1.65 x 1.65 = 2.72. Divide the new weight number by the new height number; 74.25 ÷ 2.72 = 27.3. This person’s BMI is 27.3. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Commit to your plan.
steps.content: Commit to your plan. Successful weight loss requires a commitment to yourself to stick with your plan for the long term. [20] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Join an online support group.
steps.content: Join an online support group.

steps.title: Create a written contract.
steps.content: Create a written contract. Some people find it helpful to put your plan in writing. Include why you want to lose the weight, the plan itself, how much weight you want to lose, and your target date to reach your desired weight. Then sign it as if you are signing a contract. [21] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Want more tips from wikiHow users on losing weight? Check out our I've tried everything and can't lose weight! forum .

steps.title: Include items from each food group, for every meal, in your plan.
steps.content: Include items from each food group, for every meal, in your plan. The 5 food groups include fruits, vegetables, grains, protein, and dairy. Your plate should be halfway covered with green vegetables and fruits, and the other half with protein and grains. The best dairy products to include in your diet are fat-free (skim) and low-fat (less than 1% fat). [22] X Research source Good protein sources include lean meats, beans, and fish. Nuts, seeds, and eggs are also protein sources. [23] X Research source Try to consume 3 servings per day of dairy products. Try to avoid cream cheese, cream, and butter. [24] X Research source Choose mostly grain products made from whole-grain. Some examples include whole-wheat flour, oatmeal, and brown rice. [25] X Research source Avoid packaged oatmeal, which often contains a lot of sugar. Fruits and vegetables contain fewer calories than most foods and are great sources of nutrients, vitamins, and minerals. While fruits are a great choice, they do contain calories and sugars, so limit your daily intake to about 4 servings, which is about 2 cups. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid empty calories.
steps.content: Avoid empty calories. Solid fats and sugars add calories but no nutrients to the foods we eat. Examples of foods with empty calories include cakes, cookies, pastries, pizza, ice cream, sodas, sports drinks, fruit drinks, sausage, hot dogs, and bacon. [27] X Expert Source Pouya Shafipour, MD, MS Board Certified Family Medicine Specialist Expert Interview. 8 May 2020.

steps.title: Choose healthy frozen prepared dinners.
steps.content: Choose healthy frozen prepared dinners. Clearly, preparing your meals with fresh ingredients is the best and healthiest way to go. But everyone has days when cooking meals from scratch just doesn’t fit into the schedule. Frozen dinners have evolved over time, and there are some healthy options out there. Follow these basic guidelines as you select frozen meals. Choose meals that include servings of lean meat, fish, or poultry, vegetables, and whole grains. Try to target meals that have 300 to 350 calories, 10 to 18 grams of total fat, less than 4 grams of saturated fat, less than 500 mgs of sodium, 5 grams or more of fiber, 10 to 20 grams of protein, and about 10% of the recommended daily values for vitamins and minerals.

steps.title: Check calories on food packaging.
steps.content: Check calories on food packaging. It's easier to watch calories and enjoy eating by buying pre-portioned food. 100 calories per bag popcorn, 110 calories per ice cream bar, even snacks in portioned bags allow you to monitor calories and reduce the urge to eat too much.

steps.title: Include cultural and ethnic foods in your plan.
steps.content: Include cultural and ethnic foods in your plan. Specific cultural or ethnic preferences are a way of life for many people. Include your favorite, but healthy, cultural and ethnic food choices in your weight loss plan. [28] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Drink plenty of water.
steps.content: Drink plenty of water. While drinking a lot of water is a big part of some diet programs, others place less emphasis on the amount and just emphasize the importance of water intake for reasons of general health. Some experts report that drinking water when you are hungry helps you to feel full, and therefore controls that cue your stomach sends to your brain that you need to eat. [29] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid sugary drinks, sodas, energy drinks, and sport beverages.
steps.content: Avoid sugary drinks, sodas, energy drinks, and sport beverages. Beyond drinking plenty of water, include coffee and tea, minus the added sweeteners, as part of your plan. Limit your intake of diet drinks, milk other than skim, fruit juice, and alcohol. [30] X Research source

steps.title: Break your old food habits.
steps.content: Break your old food habits. Emotional or comfort eating gets in the way of nutritional eating. Think about healthy foods you like that can replace your past unhealthy comfort foods. [31] X Research source Look up healthy recipe swaps for your favorite dishes so you won't feel so restricted.

steps.title: Pay attention to how foods make you feel physically.
steps.content: Pay attention to how foods make you feel physically. Eating something fried might taste good today, but it might not feel so good the next morning. [32] X Research source

steps.title: Slow down as you eat.
steps.content: Slow down as you eat. Your stomach will start to feel full if you slow down as you eat. Have a conversation with someone, or put the fork down between bites, to allow your stomach to tell your brain you are getting full. [33] X Research source

steps.title: Read the labels.
steps.content: Read the labels. Be aware of what you plan to eat, and read the nutrition labels to be sure you are eating what you planned. [34] X Research source Some packaging can be misleading for marketing purposes, so looking at the nutrition label is essential.

steps.title: Talk about food differently.
steps.content: Talk about food differently. Some foods are more pleasant than others, no doubt. Take control of experiencing new foods by removing the words “I can’t eat that”, and instead say “I don’t eat that”. By changing how you talk about food, it puts you in control of choosing foods you do not routinely eat. [35] X Research source Instead of talking about the foods you can no longer have, talk about all of the foods you are adding in like fruit, vegetables, lean proteins, etc. Shifting your mindset from restriction to addition can make a big difference.

steps.title: Practice healthier eating every day, and all day.
steps.content: Practice healthier eating every day, and all day. Eat breakfast, plan ahead so you know what you will eat when you get hungry, avoid over-eating which can happen when watching TV, and eat the healthy food choices first. Other routines that can help include eating smaller meals, or snacks, throughout the day instead of 3 larger meals. [36] X Research source

steps.title: Weigh yourself once a week.
steps.content: Weigh yourself once a week. The scale can help you to tweak your plan if you need to, and to stay on track with meeting your goal. [37] X Research source

steps.title: Set up your pantry and kitchen to help you.
steps.content: Set up your pantry and kitchen to help you. What you can see in your cabinet, or can easily reach for, may not always be the best choice. Keep fruit on the counter and chopped veggies in the fridge. Easy access to healthy choices can help avoid unhealthy snacking. [38] X Research source

steps.title: Reduce temptation.
steps.content: Reduce temptation. Get rid of the cookies and ice cream. Having the tempting foods within reach can pull you away from your plan. [39] X Research source

steps.title: Use smaller plate sizes.
steps.content: Use smaller plate sizes. Smaller plates can help with portion control, decreasing the number of calories you consume at mealtime. Always eat off a plate as opposed to out of a box, bag, or carton. [40] X Research source You can pre-portion out servings of snack foods and leave them in your pantry to prevent overeating from the container. Grocery stores also have a lot of pre-portioned options.

steps.title: Get plenty of sleep.
steps.content: Get plenty of sleep. People that get enough sleep burn up to 5% more calories at rest than people that do not get a good night’s sleep. Plus, getting the sleep you need increases the amount of fat you lose compared to people that sleep less than 6 hours each night. [41] X Research source

steps.title: Get back on track after a setback.
steps.content: Get back on track after a setback. Life happens. Weddings, covered dish dinners, birthday parties, game-day snacks, or a night out on the town can all involve eating, or drinking, calories that are not in your plan. [42] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Think about what you could have done differently, and plan ahead so you will be ready for those challenging events next time. [43] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Avoid the "all or nothing" mentality. Just because you messed up once, doesn't mean you can spiral out of control and have anything else you want. It happened, move on and don't be so hard on yourself.

steps.title: Ask for help.
steps.content: Ask for help. Talking to your friends and family about your weight loss plan can help you stay focused on your goal. You may have a friend that will want to join you in losing weight. Support groups are also available that can provide encouragement, as well as personal tips on struggles they encounter. [44] X Research source Sharing your goals can also prevent others from being bad influences when know you are serious about losing weight.

steps.title: Take prescription weight loss medications.
steps.content: Take prescription weight loss medications. Talk to your doctor to determine if prescription drugs for weight loss are right for you. The FDA has recently approved several agents that can help with weight loss. Using prescription products will depend on your existing medication regimen, any medical conditions you may have, and the amount of weight you need to lose.

steps.title: Avoid products that are available over-the-counter, unless your doctor agrees.
steps.content: Avoid products that are available over-the-counter, unless your doctor agrees. Over-the-counter weight loss products have not been studied and tested for efficacy the way prescription-only products have been. Your doctor may consider over-the-counter products for you, but it is important to discuss this with your doctor before you try this type of product.

steps.title: Consider forms of surgery.
steps.content: Consider forms of surgery. For some people, considering surgical options may be the safest and most effective way to reach his or her weight loss goal. Only your doctor can properly evaluate your condition and determine if these options are right for you. [45] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Four procedures are commonly done to help people lose weight. This type of procedure is called bariatric surgery. Two primary functions are provided by the available procedures. [46] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The 2 functions include restriction, which physically limits the amount of food the stomach can contain, and malabsorption, which shortens the small intestine to reduce the number of calories and nutrients the body absorbs. [47] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The 4 commonly performed procedures are called roux-en-Y gastric bypass, laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding, sleeve gastrectomy, and duodenal switch with biliopancreatic diversion. [48] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Talk to your doctor about your medications.
steps.content: Talk to your doctor about your medications. Your doctor may be able to help you, even though you do not realize it. In some cases, you may be taking prescription medications that cause weight gain or increase your appetite. By talking to your doctor about your weight loss goals, some of your medications can possibly be changed, or the dose adjusted, to help you achieve your goal. [49] X Expert Source Pouya Shafipour, MD, MS Board Certified Family Medicine Specialist Expert Interview. 8 May 2020.

steps.title: Discuss your exercise plan with your doctor.
steps.content: Discuss your exercise plan with your doctor. Depending on how much weight you need to lose, any existing medical conditions, and your age, your doctor can help to guide you in exercise and activity options that are safe for you. Healthcare professionals, like your doctor or a registered dietician, are great resources for information, guidance, and support. [50] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Be kind to yourself.
steps.content: Be kind to yourself. Don't beat yourself up if you overeat, take a breath and start fresh the next day. We didn't become overweight by overeating once in a while, overeating was a daily habit.

steps.title: Be patient.
steps.content: Be patient. It takes about 8 months to change a habit and once you start feeling healthier and people start mentioning how great you look, you will know you are on the right track!
